snippet: Alexis Tsipras, leader of the Syriza party, laid out specific economic policy proposals that, if followed, would seem to put the country on a collision course with its foreign creditors.
abstract: Head of Greece's radical left Syriza party Alexis Tsipras holds hour-long news conference to describe the measures he would take if elected; promises his first act will be to annul the terms of the country's financial rescue packages.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and NIKI KITSANTONIS

lead_paragraph: Alexis Tsipras, leader of the Syriza party, laid out specific economic policy proposals that, if followed, would seem to put the country on a collision course with its foreign creditors.

headline.seo: Greek Leftist Challenges Europe on Austerity
headline.main: Greek Leftist Aims to Void Austerity Plan
headline.print_headline: Greek Leftist Aims to Void Austerity Plan
